When someone decides it is enough to invest goes to center cicle and pushes luck in auction with other players in investmens circle. Object of auction is surprise because it is revealed after payment. Companies you own earns money for you but costs taxes too. Be careful it is possible to go bankrupt! Who went bankrupt three times is eliminated. After negotiated number of devaluations, which decrease all players cash, game ends. Who is richest wins.

boardgame.name: Napoleonic Naval Combat Scenarios: American War of Independence Edition
boardgame.description:
The American War of Independence Edition contains 23 historical scenarios for Master and Commander. The scenarios simulate naval battles from the American War of Independence and include

12 Small (1-2 ships per side) battles
5 Medium (up to 10 ships) battles
6 Large (Fleet) battles


From the back of the book:
Many of these scenarios show the French doing a lot to keep the British Royal Navy busy rather than intervening directly on land in the 13 colonies. This hampered British strategic mobility and eventually led to the surrender at Yorktown (compared to the easy evacuation of Boston), as well as the threat of losing more Caribbean colonies making the war too costly for the British.

boardgame.description:
The Zika virus was discovered recently and many problems have caused for Public Administrators and the general population. In Game based game "Todos contra a Dengue", we Dengue, Chikungunya and Leptospirosis as population to disease-causing and with this expansion, add the Zika virus. The Zika virus is also caused by the same transmitter of dengue and Chikungunya, which is the mosquito Aedes aegypti. Mosquito combat this is an efficient way to end these diseases.

Placing the Zica Virus in the game is a good way to put on the table an issue of great importance to all! For those who played Todos contra a Dengue there are few changes to the rules as described in the basic game. Only a disease that is Zica is added. The Zica virus comes into play only in one city and different from the other cities where there is a Dice D6 scroll to determine the number of people with disease, this town with Zica virus already has 12 people diseases that need to be addressed. The final rule score takes into consideration if this city with Zica virus were all treated patients or not, thereby altering the final score of the players.

boardgame.name: 9 Years to Yesterday
boardgame.description:
Leverage the past, present and future to gain your freedom.

You are a Shifter. A rare breed of human that has the ability to slip through time at will. But this ability does not come without a cost. Your kind has drawn the interest of an untouchable crime boss known only as Gary. He wishes to not only control the city, but the city today, tomorrow, and yesterday. That’s where you come in; an indentured servant, forced into a life of non-linear crime. You can’t claim to dislike the rewards of your efforts, but the risks involved have you looking for an exit strategy - a normal life. Not to seem unreasonable, Gary has proposed a game; he is willing to release one of his loyal Shifters upon completion of one last job.

You assume the role of one of four Shifters; your job is to fulfill Contracts for your boss, Gary. Contract cards outline a cargo, such as a certain quantity of contraband or an amount of credits that must be delivered to a certain year. Upon fulfilling the Contract requirements, you will receive a reward to help you on your mission. Each turn you move your pawn forward one month, naturally, within the confines of the nine year timeline of Gary’s competition. If you land on a month circled in red, you may choose an additional Contract from those available. Roll the month die to determine if you encounter Gary; will he reward your hard work or punish your incompetence?

Next, you choose one of two options. You may choose to perform any number of actions, including buying and selling guns, drugs, technology, and stocks, depositing to or withdrawing credits from the bank, fulfilling Contracts, or utilizing Subterfuge cards. Use Subterfuge cards to give you one time advantages, such as extra moves, bonus resources, or to sabotage an opponent. Or, you may choose to shift forward or backward one entire year to take advantage of varying levels of supply and demand or to reach a Contract delivery date. However, when you Shift, you must draw an Event card. Event cards can change the level of Technological Innovation, alter the value of Contraband, or manipulate at time’s Financial Health.

There are two types of Contracts: standard and release. Standard Contracts are general smuggling jobs and are worth one Contract Point. Release Contracts are tailored to each Shifter’s unique skills, but as such, are more challenging. The reward for completion of a Release Contract is that the Shifter named on the Contract receives 5 Contract Points required to win Gary’s competition. The first Shifter to collect 10 Contract Points wins Gary’s competition and their freedom.

Highlights:
Ever changing board conditions and resource values.
You must not only plan your strategy, but monitor that of your opponents; stay one step ahead.
Plays great with 2-4 players.
Advanced game play option for greater challenge.

boardgame.name: Regatta
boardgame.description:
This 1946 game appears to have been privately developed and produced and predates the somewhat similar games published by 3M, Avalon Hill and Klee by more than two decades. There is a yacht club in one corner of the 24.5 x 19 inch map, and the courses are complicated by three islands and four banks of shoals.

While the basic mechanic is simple (roll two dice), the rules and subtleties do a good job of recreating the tensions of a sailboat race. A red die determines the basic movement amount, but this is modified by matching the red-white combination against a Help and Hindrance card that evens out the results. Net moves range from 0 (6-6=blown out a sail) to 5. Lower red rolls get help and higher ones get penalized.

Unlike later games, the wind is assumed to blow constantly from the top of the board, and courses are laid out accordingly. The rules and realities of sailing apply: a boat on starboard tack has right of way over port; close-hauled over reaching or running; getting to windward of another boat hurts its movement, and so on.

There are rules for tacking, luffing and setting spinnakers. There are shoals that players can try to get over but if their turn ends on a shoal they ground. There is an advanced start process too: instead of rolling for position with highest first, players can spend three turns manoeuvering for position as in a real race.

The rulebook has extensive diagrams of various potential situations, and is designed to make the game instructive as well as fun for players who are not sailors.

boardgame.name: Snyxtrap
boardgame.description:
Snyxtrap is a game which uses the Larklamp Magic Lantern Game System. The game and system were designed by P.D. Warne.

Snyx are mischievous faerie from the ethereal realm of the Shadowfay, and one has gotten loose inside your home! Maneuvering on a board cast entirely of shadow and light, you play your hand of magical lures and traps against the other snyx hunters to be the first to capture the pesky snyx.

Each player receives a hand of 5 cards, from which they'll play 3 each turn. The cards control the movement of the Snyx or the shape of the game board. The board is comprised of light and shadows made from the Larklamp, and by sliding the panels on the lantern, the board can be modified. The Snyx is moved according to the cards played each round. The more cards you match in the 3 cards you play, the more likely that that respective card will resolve. The goal of the game is to maneuver the Snyx to a specific location.

boardgame.name: Colosseum
龍王
boardgame.description:
User summary
COLOSSEUM is a one-on-one duel card game. This game reflects many features seen in fighting video games, such as character-specific abilities, distance control, anticipating opponent's moves, three-way-deadlock skill interactions, and overdrive skills. With these features, this game provides an environment where players' risk and return fluctuate throughout the game.

Publisher's summary
1vs1の対戦カードゲーム。対戦格闘ゲームの読み合いをコンパクトにまとめた作品です。3すくみの相性を持つカードと、距離の概念を組み合わせ、常にリスク＆リターンが変動し続ける環境を構築しています。
